sn4.25:4.1: And then Māra the Wicked, after reciting these verses of disillusionment in the Buddha’s presence, left that place. He sat cross-legged on the ground not far from the Buddha, silent, embarrassed, shoulders drooping, downcast, depressed, with nothing to say, scratching the ground with a stick.
sn4.25:4.2: Then Māra’s daughters Craving, Delight, and Lust went up to Māra the Wicked,
sn4.25:5.2: What man are you upset about?
sn4.25:5.3: We’ll catch him with the snare of lust,
sn4.25:5.4: like an elephant in the wild.
sn4.25:5.5: We’ll tie him up and bring him back—
sn4.25:6.1: “In this world he is the Perfected One, the Holy One.
sn4.25:6.2: He’s not easily seduced by lust.

sn4.25:7.1: Then Māra’s daughters Craving, Delight, and Lust went up to the Buddha,
sn4.25:7.4: But the Buddha ignored them, since he was freed with the supreme ending of attachments.
sn4.25:8.1: Then Craving, Delight, and Lust withdrew to one side to make a plan.
sn4.25:8.2: “Men have a diverse spectrum of tastes.
sn4.25:8.3: Why don’t we each manifest in the form of a hundred young maidens?”
sn4.25:8.4: So that’s what they did. Then they went up to the Buddha
sn4.25:8.7: But the Buddha still ignored them, since he was freed with the supreme ending of attachments.
sn4.25:9.1: Then Craving, Delight, and Lust withdrew to one side to make a plan.
sn4.25:9.2: “Men have a diverse spectrum of tastes.
sn4.25:9.3: Why don’t we each manifest in the form of a hundred women who have never given birth?”
sn4.25:9.4: So that’s what they did. Then they went up to the Buddha
sn4.25:9.7: But the Buddha still ignored them, since he was freed with the supreme ending of attachments.
sn4.25:10.4: each manifested in the form of a hundred women who have given birth once …
sn4.25:11.4: women who have given birth twice …
sn4.25:12.5: But the Buddha still ignored them, since he was freed with the supreme ending of attachments.
sn4.25:12.6: Then Craving, Delight, and Lust withdrew to one side and said:
sn4.25:13.1: ‘In this world he is the Perfected One, the Holy One.
sn4.25:13.2: He’s not easily seduced by lust.
sn4.25:13.3: He has gone beyond Māra’s domain;
sn4.25:14.1: For if we had come on to any ascetic or brahmin like this who was not free of lust, his heart would explode, or he’d spew hot blood from his mouth, or he’d go mad and lose his mind.
sn4.25:14.2: He’d dry up, wither away, and shrivel up like a green reed that was mowed down.”
sn4.25:15.1: Then Māra’s daughters Craving, Delight, and Lust went up to the Buddha,
sn4.25:15.3: Māra’s daughter Craving addressed the Buddha in verse:
sn4.25:16.1: “Are you overwhelmed by sorrow that you meditate in the forest?
sn4.25:16.2: Have you lost a fortune, or do you long for one?
sn4.25:16.3: Or perhaps you’ve committed some crime in the village?
sn4.25:16.4: Why don’t you get too close to people?
sn4.25:16.5: And why does no-one get close to you?”
sn4.25:17.1: “I’ve reached the goal, peace of heart.
sn4.25:17.2: Having conquered the army of the likable and pleasant,
sn4.25:17.3: alone, practicing absorption, I awakened to bliss.
sn4.25:17.4: That’s why I don’t get too close to people,
sn4.25:17.5: and no-one gets too close to me.”
sn4.25:18.1: Then Māra’s daughter Delight addressed the Buddha in verse:
sn4.25:19.1: “How does a mendicant who has crossed five floods
sn4.25:19.2: usually meditate here while crossing the sixth?
sn4.25:19.3: How do they usually practice absorption so that sensual perceptions
sn4.25:19.4: are warded off and don’t get hold of them?”
sn4.25:20.1: “With tranquil body and mind well freed,
sn4.25:20.3: understanding the teaching, they practice absorption without placing the mind;
sn4.25:20.4: they’re not shaking or drifting or rigid.
sn4.25:21.1: That’s how a mendicant who has crossed five floods
sn4.25:21.2: usually meditates here while crossing the sixth.
sn4.25:21.3: That’s how they usually practice absorption so that sensual perceptions
sn4.25:21.4: are warded off and don’t get hold of them.”
sn4.25:22.1: Then Māra’s daughter Lust addressed the Buddha in verse:
sn4.25:23.1: “He lives with his community after cutting off craving,
sn4.25:23.2: and many of the faithful will cross over for sure.
sn4.25:23.3: Alas, this homeless one will snatch mankind away,
sn4.25:23.4: and lead them past the King of Death!”
sn4.25:24.2: by means of the true teaching.
sn4.25:24.3: When the Realized Ones are leading by the teaching,
sn4.25:24.4: how could anyone with discernment be jealous?”
sn4.25:25.1: Then Māra’s daughters Craving, Delight, and Lust went up to Māra the Wicked.
sn4.25:25.2: Māra the Wicked saw them coming off in the distance,
sn4.25:26.3: You dig up a hill with your nails!
sn4.25:26.4: You chew iron with your teeth!
sn4.25:27.1: You seek a footing in the deeps, as it were,
sn4.25:27.2: while lifting a rock with your head!
sn4.25:27.3: After attacking a stump with your breast, as it were,
sn4.25:28.3: But the Teacher brushed them off right there,
sn4.25:28.4: like the breeze, a fallen tuft.”
sn4.25:31.1: The Linked Discourses with Māra are complete.
